intro: Euphrasia polonica, commonly known as the Polish eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It is often found in regions with temperate climates and is valued for its medicinal properties. Euphrasia polonica is also a popular choice for herbal remedies due to its potential health benefits.
